grassMarkers.name: Switchgrass
grassMarkers.description: Clump-forming, warm-season grass with open, lacy sprays with small seeds. Panicum virgatum L., switchgrass, is native to all of the United States except California and the Pacific Northwest. It is a perennial sod-forming grass that grows 3 to 5 feet tall and can be distinguished from other warm-season grasses, even when plants are young, by the white patch of hair at the point where the leaf attaches to the stem.
